questions.text: Which of the following is an incorrect statement with respect to the basic anatomy of the bone?

options.label: A
options.text: The epiphysis of long bone has cancellous bone structure

options.label: B
options.text: The diaphysis of the long bone has compact bone structure

options.label: C
options.text: The compact bone does not have a Haversian system

options.label: D
options.text: The diaphysis is derived from the primary ossification center

questions.correct_answer: C. The compact bone does not have a Haversian system
questions.explanation: Ans. C) The compact bone does not have a Haversian system

options.label: A

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D

questions.correct_answer: A. The statement A is true, the statement B is false
questions.explanation: Ans. A) The statement A is true, the statement B is false

questions.text: The osmotically most active intracellular cation is:
All the following proteins are known as molecular motors, because of their involvement in intracellular trafficking except:
Which of the following contributes least to the osmolality of the plasma?
All of the following statements about the azurophilic granules of the neutrophils are correct except:
Which of the following will be synthesized by the smooth endoplasmic reticulum?
Most of the sodium in the body is present in:
The larvicidal major basic protein is secreted mainly from which of these blood cells?
The lipid bilayer is most permeable to:
questions.explanation:
Ans. D. Urea

Explanation:

  • • Explanation
  • • The lipid bilayer of cell membranes is selectively permeable, allowing certain substances to pass through more easily than others. Urea is a small, uncharged molecule that can diffuse freely across the lipid bilayer without the need for transport proteins. Its nonpolar nature allows it to dissolve in the hydrophobic core of the lipid bilayer, facilitating its movement between cells and their surrounding environment, urea along with water also follows lipid bilayer.
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option A. Insulin: Insulin is a large, polar protein hormone. Due to its size and charge, it cannot easily diffuse through the lipid bilayer. Instead, insulin interacts with specific receptors on the cell surface to initiate cellular responses.
  • • Option A. Insulin:
  • • Option B. Glucose: Glucose is a polar molecule and cannot readily cross the lipid bilayer by simple diffusion. It requires facilitated diffusion through glucose transporters (such as GLUT proteins) to enter cells.
  • • Option B. Glucose:
  • • Option C. Sodium ions: Sodium ions (Na⁺) are charged particles and do not pass through the lipid bilayer easily. Their movement across cell membranes is typically mediated by ion channels or active transport mechanisms.
  • • Option C. Sodium ions:
  • • Educational objective:
  • • Educational objective:
  • • Urea is the most permeable substance across the lipid bilayer due to its small size and uncharged, nonpolar characteristics, allowing it to diffuse freely through the cell membrane.
  • • Urea

questions.text: The protein Claudin is associated with which of these transmembrane proteins?

In a medicine OPD, three patients are being evaluated for diabetes. They have been given a load of glucose to do oral glucose tolerance test. Based on the below graph, which patient is in the pre-diabetic state?
Glycogen phosphorylase can be regulated by all the following except:
Which of the following does not occur in mitochondria?
Insulin promotes lipogenesis by all except:
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Inhibiting Pyruvate Dehydrogenase

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • Insulin is a key anabolic hormone that promotes lipogenesis (the synthesis of fatty acids and triglycerides) by regulating several metabolic pathways:
  • • Decreasing cAMP: Insulin reduces the levels of cyclic adenosine monophosphate (cAMP) by activating phosphodiesterase. This inhibits hormone-sensitive lipase, reducing lipolysis and promoting fat storage. Increasing Glucose Uptake: Insulin increases glucose uptake in adipose tissue and muscle by upregulating glucose transporter type 4 (GLUT-4) channels. The increased availability of glucose provides the substrate (acetyl-CoA) necessary for fatty acid synthesis. Increasing Acetyl CoA: Glucose metabolism through glycolysis leads to the formation of pyruvate, which is converted into acetyl-CoA, a precursor for fatty acid synthesis.
  • • Decreasing cAMP: Insulin reduces the levels of cyclic adenosine monophosphate (cAMP) by activating phosphodiesterase. This inhibits hormone-sensitive lipase, reducing lipolysis and promoting fat storage.
  • • Decreasing cAMP:
  • • Increasing Glucose Uptake: Insulin increases glucose uptake in adipose tissue and muscle by upregulating glucose transporter type 4 (GLUT-4) channels. The increased availability of glucose provides the substrate (acetyl-CoA) necessary for fatty acid synthesis.
  • • Increasing Glucose Uptake:
  • • Increasing Acetyl CoA: Glucose metabolism through glycolysis leads to the formation of pyruvate, which is converted into acetyl-CoA, a precursor for fatty acid synthesis.
  • • Increasing Acetyl CoA:
  • • In contrast, inhibiting pyruvate dehydrogenase (PDH) is incorrect, as insulin activates PDH. PDH catalyzes the conversion of pyruvate to acetyl-CoA, facilitating the process of lipogenesis. Inhibition of PDH would reduce acetyl-CoA availability and impair lipid synthesis.
  • • inhibiting pyruvate dehydrogenase (PDH)
  • • activates
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option A. Decreasing cAMP: True. By lowering cAMP levels, insulin downregulates lipolysis and enhances lipogenesis. Option B. Increasing Glucose Uptake: True. Increased glucose uptake leads to higher acetyl-CoA levels, promoting the synthesis of fatty acids. Option D. Increasing Acetyl CoA: True. Acetyl-CoA is a key molecule in the fatty acid synthesis pathway.
  • • Option A. Decreasing cAMP: True. By lowering cAMP levels, insulin downregulates lipolysis and enhances lipogenesis.
  • • Option A. Decreasing cAMP:
  • • Option B. Increasing Glucose Uptake: True. Increased glucose uptake leads to higher acetyl-CoA levels, promoting the synthesis of fatty acids.
  • • Option B. Increasing Glucose Uptake:
  • • Option D. Increasing Acetyl CoA: True. Acetyl-CoA is a key molecule in the fatty acid synthesis pathway.
  • • Option D. Increasing Acetyl CoA:
  • • Educational objectives:
  • • Educational objectives:
  • • Insulin activates pyruvate dehydrogenase, increasing acetyl-CoA production, which is crucial for lipogenesis. Therefore, insulin does not inhibit pyruvate dehydrogenase but rather promotes its activity.
